instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2936 padlock symbol appearing on screen.
threads.message:
I started this in a previous post a couple of weeks ago at the link below:

[url]https://www.rossmanngroup.com/boards/forum/board-repair-troubleshooting/15699-is-this-more-of-a-software-thing-macbook-pro-sn-c02hng7jdv13[/url]

I have read the chip with a chip reader and now have the .bin file so what am I dojng with it now?
Thanks

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2936 padlock symbol appearing on screen.
threads.message: Search for the first instance "$SVS" then FF out the next 112 bytes (I think from memory, go until it meets the other FFs but keep the files size the same).

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2936 padlock symbol appearing on screen.
threads.message:
OK, what programme am I using and on a mac or a pc?
Thanks again.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2936 padlock symbol appearing on screen.
threads.message:
Your favourite Hex editor.


(On Mac I use Hex Feind)

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2936 padlock symbol appearing on screen.
threads.message:
Right then, opened up with Hex Editor Neo on Windows 7, the file is just full of FF
Using control F and trying $SVS or even just $ gives nothing. The programme said the transfer was successful so I can only guess that went successfully. Does that mean the chip is blank/faulty and dead?
Thanks again

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2936 padlock symbol appearing on screen.
threads.message:
All FFs means the file is empty; it probably failed to read.
Doesn't mean the chip is dead, just that it failed to be read.

I don't know how to use the programmer you used. I usually solder it into a pcb I made up and read it with an rPi.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2936 padlock symbol appearing on screen.
threads.message:
With the ic in the correct way round this time.
Now you're talking. Ok So I am at the first instance of $SVS so what am I looking to do now?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2936 padlock symbol appearing on screen.
threads.message:
There are 2 instances of $SVS in the binary. One will have a bunch of crap after it and the other won't. Make the one that has a bunch of crap look like the one that doesn't. Make sure you keep an original copy in the case you screw up!
After the fix do a PRAM reset and install new OSX!!

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2936 padlock symbol appearing on screen.
threads.message: OK then, so the information has be come corrupted then in some way?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2936 padlock symbol appearing on screen.
threads.message: Just upload the file somewhere and I'll do it.....

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2936 padlock symbol appearing on screen.
threads.message:
The computer is back together, but not switching on. When trying to switch on from battery only the cpu fans spins for maybe 2 seconds then stops. The power light comes on in that time and then goes off when the fan stops. When connecting to power, the fans starts to spin for 2 seconds, then stops and starts again. Still will not switch on. I tried a p tram reset just in case and nothing happens so it isn't switching on. When power is connected, the light on the connector lights up green then goes red. Has something gone wrong with the programming or am I diagnosing a power problem?
Thanks

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2936 padlock symbol appearing on screen.
threads.message: Bad BIOS file. Board was powering on fine before, and now has a bad BIOS file. Better to post the original file here and let someone clean it for you.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2936 padlock symbol appearing on screen.
threads.message: Yeah Duke did that, I could see the changes he made and when loading the file I read the new file from the chip again to make sure the file had hit the chip which it did. I will upload old and new after this post.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2936 padlock symbol appearing on screen.
threads.message:
Yeah I think I messed it up. Try this one. 
[url]https://drive.google.com/file/d/0ByfhQ_x0v-tZUE81RVVYSUFGc0E/view?usp=sharing[/url]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2936 padlock symbol appearing on screen.
threads.message: Looking at the file, wo thats a big change. I will get the change done and update

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2936 padlock symbol appearing on screen.
threads.message:
AMAZING. I wrote the data to the chip then put the thing back together. I used a hdd with an os on already which booted fine. Installed os x on the computers own hard drive and now it has Lion on and working again!!
Thanks again!!!
